intro: Haplophyllum hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy haplophyllum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Haplophyllum hirsutum is often found in alpine meadows and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
